intro: Syngonanthus bellus, commonly known as the beautiful spike-moss, is a rare and delicate species of spore-bearing plant found in specific habitats. It belongs to the family Selaginellaceae and is characterized by its slender, branching stems covered in small, scale-like leaves. The plant produces spores in specialized structures called sporangia, which are typically clustered in cone-like formations. Syngonanthus bellus thrives in moist, shaded environments, often in rocky or forested areas. Due to its limited distribution and fragile nature, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
